definition: to ruin a family/to lose a fortune
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: He exhausted a fortune in stock-market speculation.
sentences.chinese: 他在股市投机买卖中倾家荡产。

sentences.english: Stocks tumbled to their lowest level today, and many people have been reduced to poverty and ruin.
sentences.chinese: 达到了有史以来的浪谷，许多人都为此倾家荡产。

sentences.english: Max lost his shirt on that bank deal alchemy.
sentences.chinese: 马克思被那笔银行交易的发财梦搞得倾家荡产。

sentences.english: In a business like this you can make a lot of money, but you can also lose your shirt.
sentences.chinese: 做这样一笔生意，你可能一夜暴富，也可能倾家荡产。

sentences.english: They figured that people shouldn’t have to file for bankruptcy because they got sick.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为，人们不应该为了治病而搞得倾家荡产。

sentences.english: Would you be willing to throw your entire family's savings into the endless whirlpool of accident compensation?
sentences.chinese: 你愿意倾家荡产去填补事故赔偿的无敌漩涡吗？

definition: to be willing to sacrifice everything one has (idiom)
to do all one can/to give all one has
to sacrifice one's wealth to save the state (idiom)
family bankrupt and the people dead (idiom); ruined and orphaned/destitute and homeless
lit. stake a thousand pieces of gold on one throw (idiom); to throw away money recklessly/extravagant
